attributes.action: Prevent anyone with a serious conviction from being in Public Office.
attributes.additional_details: Individuals in Public Office should be setting an example of the behaviour expected from members of the public. They should not have a serious conviction before they take office and should be removed immediately if they are convicted during their term. It is important to be clear no-one is above the law, even if they have been voted in before they were convicted.
attributes.background: Individuals with a conviction for a serious offence should not be allowed to stand for or remain as an MP or Councillor.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/706177
